snippet: Opioid painkillers are dangerously overprescribed, but Florida has shown how states can confront this problem.
abstract: Editorial warns that opioid painkillers like Vicodin and OxyContin are overprescribed in every state, but particularly in Southern states, which has led to higher death rates from overdoses; notes that Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has credited Florida with achieving first substantial decline in prescription drug overdose deaths in past decade; contends Florida's approach offers model for dealing with the problem.
lead_paragraph: Opioid painkillers are dangerously overprescribed, but Florida has shown how states can confront this problem.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations
